process_section.title: The SNAPLY Approach
process_section.description: Want to see how we deliver? Here's our process in a nutshell.

steps.name: Discovery
steps.description: We begin with an introductory call to understand your unique business needs. During this meeting, we discuss your goals, challenges, and target audience. Our team gathers insights to create a comprehensive understanding of your brand, setting the stage for a successful partnership.

steps.name: Strategy
steps.description: After the discovery phase, we craft a customized digital marketing strategy tailored to your objectives. This includes selecting the right channels, defining key performance indicators (KPIs), and establishing a timeline. We present this strategy to you for feedback and approval, ensuring alignment with your vision.

steps.name: Execution
steps.description: Once the strategy is approved, our expert team gets to work. We launch targeted campaigns across platforms like Google Ads and social media and optimize your website for SEO. Throughout this phase, we maintain open communication, providing updates and adjustments based on real-time data.

steps.name: Analysis
steps.description: After the campaigns are live, we continuously monitor their performance. We analyze key metrics to measure success against the defined KPIs. At the end of the campaign, we provide a detailed report outlining results, insights, and recommendations for future strategies. This ensures ongoing growth and improvement for your brand.

faq_section.title: SNAPLY Answers to Your Most Common Questions

questions.q: Do I need to give Snaply access to my social media accounts and email passwords?
questions.a: Yes, to effectively manage your digital marketing strategies, Snaply will require access to your social media accounts. However, we prioritize your security and privacy. We recommend you to use 2-factor verification for all your accounts for more security. Please do not share your email passwords or any sensitive account information to anyone other than us.

questions.q: Does Snaply create posts or videos for social media?
questions.a: Currently, Snaply does not create posts or videos for clients. We manage posting schedules, engage with the audience, and handle overall social media strategy, but clients provide the content.

questions.q: Do I get a dedicated account manager with my plan?
questions.a: Standout Plan: Includes general support but does not come with a dedicated manager. BeHeard Plan: Comes with a shared account manager to assist with your campaign needs. BeSeen Plan and Make Your Mark Plan: Both include a dedicated account manager who provides personalized support, strategic oversight, and direct communication.

questions.q: Do I need to sign a long-term contract?
questions.a: We offer both long term and short term agreements. Our standard contracts typically require a commitment, but we also have month-to-month options available.

questions.q: I run a small shop. Can Snaply help me, or do you only work with large businesses?
questions.a: Absolutely! Snaply caters to businesses of all sizes, from shops, clubs, and diners to larger enterprises. Plans are designed to fit your unique needs.

footer_section.notes: NOTES ON ALL SERVICES No Content Creation: Snaply focuses on strategic management and optimization of campaigns, not on producing the creative assets. Payment Terms Service Fees: Payments are due at the start of each month. Minimum Contract: We offer a paid, one-month trial period at the standard rate for clients who want to experience our services. After the initial month, a 3-month contract is required for continued service to ensure the effectiveness of your digital marketing strategy. These prices cover only Snaply's professional services for managing and optimizing digital campaigns. Clients are responsible for their ad spend, which is paid directly to platforms like Google and Facebook. Additionally, clients must provide the content for social media posts. This pricing structure offers competitive rates while maintaining the quality of service that Snaply provides. Adjustments can be made based on market feedback and competition.
